Package fel.cvut.pjv

Class FirePowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • fel.cvut.pjv.FirePowerUp
  • public class FirePowerUp
extends java.lang.Object
    Class increments damage upon activation by a vehicle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FirePowerUp

        public FirePowerUp​(int rowPos,
                   int colPos,
                   int[] facingDirection,
                   boolean isTransparent,
                   int firePowerIncrement)
        FirePowerUp constructor.
        Parameters:
        rowPos - Row position on board to set - make sure it is not out of bounds.
        colPos - Column position on board to set - make sure it is not out of bounds.
        facingDirection - It is recommended to always use "up", deviating will not cause errors but might be confusing to maintain.
        isTransparent - It is recommended to always use true - upon using false it will not be possible to activate as it can not be driven on.
        firePowerIncrement - Value to add to vehicles armor. Recommended to use positive values.

    • Method Detail

      • getFirePowerIncrement

        public int getFirePowerIncrement()
        Gets how many damage points will be added to vehicle damage.

      • getHit

        public boolean getHit​(ExplosionTile e)
        Handles getting hit by explosions. Return value dictates whether it was destroyed by the hit or no. Gets called by GameController upon exploding tile that contains this entity.
        Parameters:
        e - Explosion tile that hit the entity - must not be null.
        Returns:
        True means destroyed, false means survived.
        See Also:
        GameController

      • getDrivenOn

        public void getDrivenOn​(Vehicle v)
        Handles getting driven on by a vehicle. Is usually empty for non-transparent entities.

      • getSpriteType

        public java.lang.String getSpriteType()
        Gets sprite type do be displayed by view. Direction is sprite is handled inside view.

      • getFacingDirection

        public int[] getFacingDirection()
        Gets facing direction of entity. For non-movable entities default value is "up" or {-1,0}.
        Returns:
        {-1,0} means up, {0,1} means right, {1,0} means down, {0,-1} means left.

      • setFacingDirection

        public void setFacingDirection​(int[] direction)
        Sets facing direction of this. Should be only used on entities which can be moved. {-1,0} means up, {0,1} means right, {1,0} means down, {0,-1} means left.

      • getRowPos

        public int getRowPos()
        Gets row position of this.

        protected void setRowPos​(int rowPos)

        public int getColPos()
        Gets column position of this.
